title: Re: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
content:
The story sounds dumb, now the movie could be COMPLETELY different as I hate judging a movie by it's trailer. But the premise sounds like a milk job on the story. War being waged against all pirates?

What I liked about the 1st one was that it had an independent story and didn't take everything so seriously.

title: Re: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
content:
Well, there's 3 movies out right now (that I know of) that are a third sequel: Pirates, Shrek, and Spider-Man. Pirates' and Shrek's sequels were just made for money, so they weren't as good as the original. Spider-man, on the other hand, was based on a comic book *series,* and had more to work with, so the sequels were probably just as good, or better.
Of course, I still need to see them to know for sure. But I'm guessing I'll like Spider-Man 3 better than Shrek 3 and Pirates 3 combined.

If you ask me, though, a sequel is only really good if it's part of the whole story (such as Harry Potter.)-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
content:
Well, I don't believe there are that many people in Hollywood who just want to offer quality movies and not care about money. Pretty much everything is because of the money. Some fans, most of them probably, may be glad, and are, if their favourite movies get sequels, but I don't think there was much point even in Spiderman 2 (or 3) for example, to the general public. One movie is enough. Although, I just can't wait to see Ocean's 13 soon. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"

title: Re: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
content:
The Pirates story has definitely been befouled with these sequels, but I'll be watching this one when it comes out just for the sake of completion. Besides, I got a free pass to see it at the local cinema for breaking an amusing record at racquetball.

As for Ocean's 13... I saw the trailer for that when I went to see Spiderman 3 the other week. I thought to myself, "I'd better not be about to read the number 13." But yes, I did. Very >100 Dalmations. Still, it could be a good movie yet. I'll just have to wait and see.

title: Re: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
content:
I really liked both of the Pirates sequels, especially 3. I'm not going to spoil the story, but the ending is going to tick off more than a few people simply because it's the last thing you'd expect. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

Also, there's a scene after the credits which you should stick around to see, but it's not as good as the post-credits scenes from the first two movies."A man is the less likely to become great the more he is dominated by reason: few can achieve greatness - and none in art - if they are not dominated by illusion."
--Mr. Doctor

title: Re: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]DUDE! What the heck happened? That ship had like 500 cannons on it. And it LOST. That made NO SENSE! Why the heck did the armada just GO AWAY? No really... WHY did the armada just leave?

Ugh there was so many plot holes.[hr][/quote] I felt the same way about the ending. Plus, the bad guy (what's his name) just konked out at the end. He was such a bad ass for the first 2.5 hours, then at the last second he gives up. Totally disappointing.

But even so, other than the end I thought it was good. I didn't like the second movie because it just seemed to go on forever. This one was just as long, but was paced better than the second one. Or maybe I just had low expectations -- ie, I went in expecting to just sit back and shut my mind down for 3 hours.

So I did think it was entertaining for the most part; I was just really disappointed with the end.

title: Pirates 3
content:
Hooray for Gal! I was worried I'd be the only one here turning my nose up at the third Pirates film. Seriously--Barbossa's character is what kept me going the whole time.

The rest of it panned out like some daytime television soap opera. Person X betrays Y for a deal with Z who is secretly helping W who has been in cahoots with Y who was trying to backstab X before Z showed up on the scene in the first place, prompting W to betray Z for Y. Lost? Don't worry, it'll all be sorted one dilemma at a time, with special effects up the wazzoo.

I'm so glad my girlfriend's work was giving away tickets to a free screening; I'd have felt ripped off if I'd had to spend money on this.

I still heart Barbossa, though. He's great.

Edit: I spelled Barbossa incorrectly.

title: Re: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
content:
I dunno, as the movie started, I wasn't feeling Barbossa's vibe. It seemed like Rush was trying too hard. After a while that feeling disappeared though...--------------------
